metadata.title: CVE-2017-6335 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The QuantumTransferMode function in coders/tiff.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.25and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(out-of-bounds read and application crash) via a small samples per pixelvalue in a CMYKA TIFF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6335` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.25-8
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.25-8
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.25-8
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.25-8
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.25-8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.25-8').
